channel.title: Need new laptop
channel.description:
I was initially going to fix my old Dell Inspiron 6000 (POS these days), since the processor is clocked at 593MHz atm, and I have a 1.6GHz in it (going bad obviously), Instead of just fixing this computer, as there are a few parts that are going bad now. Looking for a laptop only, I have a great working desktop, but my laptop comes with me to work.
What it will need to do: [ul][li]Compatible with most games. EX: Minecraft, LOTRO[/li] [li]Able to multi-task easily (aka, dual, triple, or quad cores. No single cores)[/li] [li]Can dual-screen (my dekstop monitor can swap between 3 connections, so I would love to make use of that feature)[/li] [li]Good for the price, meaning not a computer that you are paying more for the name, and not quality.[/li] [li]Compatible with most OS's (linux, hackintosh aka macintosh)[/li][/ul]
The only one I have found, that fits my liking largely (possibly not all of the standards), is this: http://www.amazon.com/dp/B0044BCZ0E/?tag=newwpcoupon-20
My budget: (lol at my savings having the min, and my debit having the large sum) [img]http://true-programas.netii.net/images/1296252453.png[/img]

item.title: Need new laptop
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

OK actually I have had one problem. And that’s gaming. But doesn’t look like yours will have that problem

Read full topic

item.title: Need new laptop
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“k0 twin, post:8, topic:380243”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=476074.msg3481593#msg3481593 date=1296182772]

I highly recommend ASUS. I have one and I love it.

My uncle had one, but it had a tendency to over-heat. Im thinking with the style of that laptop I am looking at, it should have no problem.
[/quote]
I got one of the cheaper ones ($500) a little over a year ago and have had basically zero problems. And if you’re getting one of the higher end ones then yeah, I bet it would be great.[/quote]
Now to decide if its going to be better to get it off Amazon, or to see if a store 2-3 hours away has it

Read full topic

item.title: Need new laptop
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“jmood128, post:6, topic:380243”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=476074.msg3481593#msg3481593 date=1296182772]

I highly recommend ASUS. I have one and I love it.

My uncle had one, but it had a tendency to over-heat. Im thinking with the style of that laptop I am looking at, it should have no problem.
[/quote]

That’s weird… So far Ive ran my laptop almost 3 days straight now and it hasn’t even touched to the point were I would want to shut it off for over heating…[/quote]
Hmm, its very well possible it was the design of his laptop. He had a:

newegg.com

ASUS Laptop G Series G1S-A1 Intel Core 2 Duo T7500 (2.20 GHz) 2 GB...

Buy ASUS Laptop G Series G1S-A1 Intel Core 2 Duo T7500 (2.20 GHz) 2 GB Memory 160 GB HDD NVIDIA GeForce 8600M GT 15.4" Windows Vista Home Premium with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

Not very much room for ventilation

Read full topic

What it will need to do:
[ul][li]Compatible with most games. EX: Minecraft, LOTRO[/li]

[li]Compatible with most OS’s (linux, hackintosh aka macintosh)[/li][/ul]
